intro: Diodia teres var. angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf diodia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and sometimes edible plants. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and elliptical, with a slightly hairy surface. It is often found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woodlands.
